summary: Congress established the Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy in 2007 to develop transformative energy technology that may be too high risk for private industry to undertake. We looked at how ARPA-E coordinates its research with other offices within the Department of Energy. The agency has practices that help manage overlap and duplication of its energy-related research projects. Officials from other DOE offices and elsewhere participate early...
title: Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy: Agency Has Practices for Avoiding Duplication and Involving Stakeholders in the Development of Research Programs
